Name: Green Deacon
Instructions: MIST chilled glass with spray or rinse of absinthe to coat the inside and set aside. SHAKE other ingredients with ice and fine strain into absinthe-rinsed chilled glass.
Review: Actually, a shade of orange-red rather than green, the name is a reference to the absinthe in this unusual combination of ingredients. The absinthe-rinse is a subtle addition to the Rosy Deacon but propels this classic into a more interesting place.
History: Created in 2009 by Jim Meehan at PDT in New York City, USA, this is a riff on the Rosy Deacon in Stanley M. Jones' 1977 Jones' Complete Barguide .
Nutrition: One serving of Green Deacon contains 168 calories
